aWLI_StateProvision.content: I TERMS AND DEFINITIONS 1. Insurance Contract means an agreement between the Policyholder and the Insurer whereby: - the Policyholder agrees to pay the Insurance Premium at an extent and according to the procedure set forth in the Insurance Contract, and - the Insurer agrees to pay the Insurance Indemnity in the events and at the extent set forth in the Insurance Contract. 2. Insurance Policy means the document issued by the Insurer as a proof of entry into the Insurance Contract. 3. Insurer means Swedbank Life insurance SE (hereinafter alternatively referred to as "Swedbank Life Insurance") represented by the tied insurance agent Swedbank AS. 4. Policyholder means the natural person specified in the Insurance Contract who enters into the Insurance Contract with the Insurer. 5. Insured means a natural person, whose life is being insured and who is also the Policyholder. At the time of entering in the Insurance Contract, the Insured must 18 to 50 years of age. At the end of the insurance period - not older than 55 years of age. 6. Guardian means the natural guardians (parents) of the Beneficiary, the guardian appointed by the Orphans Court or by other competent institution, or the adopter approved by court. 7. Bank means Swedbank AS. 8. Account means the Policyholder's account specified in the Insurance Contract. 9. Beneficiary means the natural person stated in the Insurance Contract, to whom the Insurer agrees to pay the Insurance Indemnity upon occurrence of Insured Event. The Policyholder may change the Beneficiary during the term of the Insurance Contract by filing a written application to the Insurer. 10. Insured Event means the death of the Insured during the time when the Insurance Cover is in force (the "Event of Death of the Insured"). The insured's death during the time, when the insurance cover has been suspended or terminated, is not considered an Insured Event. 11. Insurance Cover is the insurer's liability upon occurrence of the Insured Event during the time when the Insurance Cover is in force to pay the Insurance Indemnity in an amount and under conditions determined by the Insurance Contract. 12. Sum Insured means the amount of money, at the extent of which the life of the Insured is insured. The Sum Insured is equivalent to employees' monthly average gross pay, as determined by the Central Statistics Board of the Republic of Latvia in the last quarter of the previous calendar year, multiplied by 12. The amount of the Sum Insured is reviewed annually on 1 April. 13. Insurance Indemnity means the amount of money paid to the Beneficiary upon occurrence of an Event Insured. If an Insured Event occurs as a result of a traffic accident, the payment of the Insurance Indemnity will be equivalent to two Sums Insured. 14. Insurance Premium means the payment that the Policyholder has a duty to make to the Insurer under the Insurance Contract. The Insurance Premium varies during the contract in accordance with changes in the Sum Insured. 15. Insurance Contract Currency for payment of Insurance Premiums and the Insurance Indemnity shall be Latvian lats. 16. Road Traffic Accident means an accident, in road traffic or other place where motoring is possible, where at least one vehicle is involved and which has resulted in the death of the Insured as evidenced by investigation and / or court documents.
aWLI_StateProvision.Title: I TERMS AND DEFINITIONS
aWLI_StateProvision.Name: Terms and conditions-Definitions
